bibl.title: Letter from Leslie W. Weedon to Henry Rose Carter, April 14, 1919

div1.p: Weedon writes that [he] will work to persuade Tampa officials to outlaw rain water cisterns for mosquito control.

div1.head: Letter from Leslie W. Weedon to Henry Rose Carter, April 14, 1919

opener.dateline:
Dr. Leslie Weedon
EYE, EAR, NOSE AND THROAT
2ND FLOOR AM, NAT'L BANK BUILDING
Tampa, Fla.
April 14 - 19

div1.p:
Since writing
you last Saturday
it has come to
mind that may be
I should not as
a private citizen
have expected you
as an official to
discuss or advise
with me concerning
the matter in question
C1
B23
when there exists proper
state officials in whose
hands rests such matters.
So, I will say I had
no desire to violate
any of the proprieties
& what ever you may
say to me I will re-
gard as entirely personal
Tampa has grown
greatly since you
knew it twenty years
ago & with the growth,
rain water cisterns &
barrels have increased
pari passu. As you
know, there is no
need of this as we
have a good public
water system. I shall
this summer endeavor
to persuade the city
authorities that they
are a sanitary nui-
sance & have them
done away with.
If this can be accom-
plished here perhaps
other Fla cities & port
towns may follow
suit & something will
be gained.
